page.title: 06Education in the Cowtons
page.content: Pre-school education is available in both villages. North Cowton has a nursery twice a week. 15 years ago it drew children from a 5 mile radius but now other villages have started their own groups, now North Cowton has only 10 children. East Cowton playgroup started 5 years ago and has 18 members. Both villages have Primary Schools. North & South Cowton School is housed in 2 buildings, with a separate canteen, meals are now brought from East Cowton. The school population is declining - 32 in Autumn 1985. There are 2 full time teachers. Children generally move to Richmond schools at the age of 11. The present East Cowton school was built in 1978, has a population of 68, and 3 full time teachers. At 11, children move on to the Northallerton secondary schools.
